scenarioDescription:
The HN Peg Exoplanetary System


Overview

HN Peg is a star with 1.08 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.01 times its radius. It is located 59.09 light years away from the solar system.

HN Peg is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HN Peg system


HN Peg b

HN Peg b was discovered by the Spitzer Space Telescope observatory, in 2007-01, using the imaging method. Its semi-major axis is 773.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HN Peg b is 6995.587 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HN Peg b is 11.777 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HN Peg b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HN Peg, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Spitzer Space Telescope.
name: HN Peg - System With 1 Exoplanet
